channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT

item.title: Report I-2023080058
item.description:
Report I-2023080058

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: T FORCE FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FREIGHT WAS LOADED ONTOP OF THESE DRUMS. FREIGHT RUBBED ACROSS THE TOP AND DAMAGED THE LID. SPILLED DOWN THE SIDE AND LEFT A LITTLE PUDDLE ON THE TOP. DONT LOAD ONTOP OF DRUMS.

item.title: Report E-2023080926
item.description:
Report E-2023080926

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: WEST VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, two (2) 1.3-gallon jugs of UN3149 were crushed during transit and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer floor and adjacent boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools to collect all freestanding product and other UN3149-impacted materials in one (1) 50-gallon drum and one (1) 30 gallon drum for disposal by R+L.
